channel.title: Comments on: Biopolitics and Vajrayana Buddhism, Part 1 (Padraic Fitzgerald)
channel.description: E-SUPPLEMENT TO THE JOURNAL FOR CULTURAL AND RELIGIOUS THEORY

item.title: By: bogdan
item.dc:creator: bogdan
item.description: To be considered, also, the buddhist counter-biopolitics of not giving birth, not bringing into existence other humans. Not in the sense that bringing humans to life should be a blamable act, but in the sense that this is not representative and a priority for human beings, the priority being the liberation from suffering and from samsara.
